stream_context.summary: Kaze worked on the early block-out of Course 11 after abandoning the previous volcano theme. The new concept is Bowser’s industrial oil-rig and airship yard, tentatively titled “Frantic Fleet Factory.” Most of the session was spent brainstorming mission flow, large rock-spire geometry, and placeholder assets. He also briefly revisited Course 1 to lengthen Star 1.

development_findings.summary: Course 11 was completely re-themed from a volcano to Bowser’s oil-rig / airship production base, working title “Frantic Fleet Factory.”
development_findings.quote: Right, so the whole volcano theme is gone now – we want it to be something like an oil rig.

development_findings.summary: Mission plan for Course 11: (1) disrupt minion worksite, (2) workers’ strike – climb an interior crane to decapitate a central Bowser statue, (3) vertical climb section, (4) floor-level power generator, (5) red-coin zone off to the side, (6) underwater 8-bit pipe challenge.
Central set-piece will be a huge Bowser statue carved into a stylised ocean spire, with oil pouring from its mouth; the crane sequence will ‘behead’ it to reveal the star.
development_findings.quote: With the crane you just behead him and get the star.

development_findings.summary: Level geometry will rely on tall, stylised ocean spires inspired by New Super Mario Bros. mountains; Kaze experimented with geo-nodes, vertex colours, and low-tri repeating modules to keep performance reasonable.
Planned interactive objects: moving cranes, shipping-container platforms, hook lifts, seesaws, zip-lines, oil jets, thwomps gating access to the crane in Mission 1.
Course 1 Star 1 will be extended: player rides a plant onto a tree (or mushroom), then spins up a relocated windmill for added verticality.
development_findings.quote: I was thinking we’re going to add something else… the star kind of just takes you around the whole level like that.

development_findings.summary: End-game cut-scene is on hold until Zeina finishes new animations.
development_findings.quote: I still also need to do the end cutscene, but I was waiting for the animations for Zeina first.

development_findings.summary: Hypothetical optimisation: if N64 had a 16 MB RAM pack, music could be stored as MP3 and decoded to WAV during loads to save ROM space, but Kaze dismissed it due to long load times and hardware limits.
development_findings.quote: If we had a 16 megabyte expansion pack… we could decode the MP3s into the additional 8 megabytes… although that would probably cause really long load times.

development_findings.summary: The level is forecast to be triangle-heavy; Kaze is considering RSP load and culling strategies to maintain framerate.
development_findings.quote: This level is going to absolutely murder the triangles.

context_findings.summary: Design philosophy: ideas must solve concrete gameplay problems; random theme suggestions are largely rejected.
context_findings.quote: Designing something is not just about coming up with ideas, it’s about solving whatever problem you have in design.

context_findings.summary: Kaze feels modern games give illusory freedom; he over-analyses play and worries he is ‘just following instructions.’
context_findings.quote: Maybe freedom in games just doesn’t exist… I’m actually just following instructions I’ve laid out myself.

context_findings.summary: Personal life moment: he and Zeina built a closed-jar terrarium and ‘touched grass’ the day before the stream.
context_findings.quote: Me and Zeina… went out and we made a terrarium in a closed jar.

context_findings.summary: Age reference: Kaze confirms he is 27.
He avoids streaming other games because live chat distracts him from enjoying the experience.
context_findings.quote: I usually don’t like playing games on stream because… I don’t feel like I can actually just focus on the moment.

context_findings.summary: Concern over project discoverability: the current title ‘Return to Yoshi’s Island 64’ may not be highly searchable.
context_findings.quote: That might not be the most searchable name, so…

zeina.summary: Zeina is animating the end-game cut-scene; delivery delays are holding that task.
zeina.quote: I was waiting for the animations for Zeina first. They took a while.

key_stories.title: Volcano to Oil-Rig Pivot
key_stories.summary: Course 11’s original volcano concept felt uninspired, prompting a full re-theme to Bowser’s industrial oil-rig and airship facility.
key_stories.challenge: Existing volcano assets didn’t excite the team and lacked distinctive platform ideas.
key_stories.process: Kaze researched oil rigs, airship landing pads, and Rico Harbor references, then sketched new mission flow and terrain.
key_stories.outcome: New identity ‘Frantic Fleet Factory’ with rock spires, cranes, and Bowser statue centerpiece now guides further work.
key_stories.key_quote: This is actually going to be a bit difficult because now that we switched to the oil rig theming we need some new platform ideas.

key_stories.title: Bowser Statue & Crane Strike
key_stories.summary: Mission 2 revolves around a worker strike that lets Mario operate a tall crane to destroy a monumental Bowser statue.
key_stories.challenge: Design a memorable objective that differs between missions and fits the oil-rig narrative.
key_stories.process: Placed statue at level centre, planned thwomps to block crane in Mission 1, and envisioned tight interior climb during strike.
key_stories.outcome: Clear multi-mission progression and dramatic set-piece were locked in.
key_stories.key_quote: We could have a crane-climb mission so the whole mission would be inside the crane – that could be really cool.

key_stories.title: Course 1 Star Revision
key_stories.summary: Kaze felt Star 1 in Course 1 ended too quickly, so he drafted a new vertical route using a plant, tall tree/mushroom, and repositioned windmill.
key_stories.challenge: Initial path was ‘just a line’ and lacked engagement.
key_stories.process: Mapped new objects and discussed replacing the tree with a mushroom for readability.
key_stories.outcome: More expansive, tutorial-friendly first star is planned.
key_stories.key_quote: I added a bit more to it… then you just spin on top of the windmill and the star takes you around the whole level.
